DataElement.preferredName: Patient Biopsy Confirmed Clear Cell Ovary Malignant Neoplasm Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Yes No Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/not applicable indicator related to a person who receives medical treatment that had removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body to confirm that a malignant neoplasm within the ovary is of the morphology of a cell with empty-appearing cytoplasm when viewed with a light microscope which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Biopsy Confirmed Clear Cell Ovary Malignant Neoplasm Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information regarding a person who receives medical treatment that had removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body to confirm that a malignant neoplasm within the ovary is of the morphology of a cell with empty-appearing cytoplasm when viewed with a light microscope which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Biopsy Confirmed Clear Cell Ovary Malignant Neoplasm Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.:Confirmed; having been established or verified.:A cell with empty-appearing cytoplasm when viewed with a light microscope.:One of the paired female reproductive glands containing the ova or germ cells; the ovary's stroma is a vascular connective tissue containing numbers of ovarian follicles enclosing the ova; surrounding this stroma is a more condensed layer of stroma called the tunica albuginea.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.
A cell with empty-appearing cytoplasm when viewed with a light microscope.
One of the paired female reproductive glands containing the ova or germ cells; the ovary's stroma is a vascular connective tissue containing numbers of ovarian follicles enclosing the ova.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: If primary tumor has less tha
ReferenceDocuments.description: If primary tumor has less than 50% clear cell histomorphology or if the primary slides are unavailable, was a biopsy done of the recurrent or persistent tumor and confirmed to have at least 50% clear cell morphology?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have at least 50% clear cell histomorphology or a histologically documented recurrence with at least 50% clear cell histomorphology?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the primary tumor at least 50% endometrioid or clear cell morphology or is there histologically documented recurrence with at least 50% endometrioid or clear cell morphology?
